content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the integral from, 6 to x, of, open parenthesis, negative, t squared, minus t, plus 6, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>. On which of the following intervals is <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increasing?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma negative one half, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, negative 3 comma 2, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open bracket, negative one half comma infinity, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>∞</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, negative infinity comma negative 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="open bracket, 2 comma infinity, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open bracket, negative 3 comma 2, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
